Congratulations on scoring those deals! You're already a savvy shopper!

Tracking your purchases and staying within your budget are crucial skills to master. Here are some tips to help you do just that:

1. **Create a budget**: Set a realistic budget for yourself, and allocate a specific amount for clothing and accessories each month. You can use the 50/30/20 rule as a starting point: 50% for necessities, 30% for discretionary spending, and 20% for saving and debt repayment.
2. **Use a budgeting app**: There are many budgeting apps available, such as Mint, Personal Capital, or YNAB (You Need a Budget). These apps can help you track your income, expenses, and stay within your budget.
3. **Keep a purchase log**: Keep a spreadsheet or a notebook to log each purchase, including the item, price, and date. This will help you track your spending and identify areas where you can cut back.
4. **Set a "30-day rule"**: When you see something you want to buy, wait 30 days before making the purchase. This can help you determine if the item is something you truly need or just a impulse buy.
5. **Use cashback and rewards**: Use cashback credit cards or sign up for rewards programs that offer points or discounts on your purchases. This can help you earn money back or accumulate points that can be redeemed for future purchases.
6. **Avoid impulse buys**: Try to avoid buying items on impulse, especially if they're not on sale or within your budget. Take time to think about whether you really need the item and if it's worth the cost.
7. **Shop during sales**: Plan your shopping trips during sales periods, like Black Friday, and look for discounts, coupons, or promo codes that can help you save money.
8. **Consider a "one in, one out" policy**: For every new item you bring into your closet, consider getting rid of an old one to maintain a balanced wardrobe and prevent clutter.

To track your purchases, you can use a simple spreadsheet or a budgeting app. Here's a template to get you started:

| Date | Item | Original Price | Discount | Final Price | Category |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 11/27 | Boots | $150 | 40% | $90 | Shoes |
| 11/27 | Sweater | $50 | 20% | $40 | Tops |

By tracking your purchases and staying within your budget, you'll be able to make more intentional buying decisions and avoid overspending.

Remember, it's all about being mindful of your spending habits and making conscious choices that align with your financial goals. Happy shopping (and budgeting)!
